intro: Erigeron regalis, commonly known as the royal fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and prairies, and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its showy white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron regalis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
